posts.body:
>>48db7c2d-4c12-4734-8d9a-26e0aee956b6
>>344f7b38-aa22-4a1c-9937-8348839b5a49
>>1294e778-121e-4ea2-8c85-65d91e5737ad
Also going for 11. This should be an anonymous image board and not some reddit clone.

>>8ab74d1e-8355-4a72-8314-28672fc964fb
8chan had several events that boosted user numbers tremendously. Discussion was getting shittier in 2015, then 2016 happened and all went to hell. Thousands of shills hired by both sides of the american election and glowniggers galore. Then Tarrant happened and normies started flooding the gates. 
I suspect many of the new users from after 2015 haven't followed since they aren't familiar with bunkers. 8chan had it's first large migration when 4chan started clamping down and moot started fucking with /pol/ and gamergate. It was mostly /v/irgins and a few /pol/acks, I suspect most /v/ anons are in the cake kikes bunker and the /pol/ core base is spread out on several bunkers.

>>d63e71ee-fa00-4f60-b278-24faba7a07e4
>Tor, I2P and VPN
Document seems really fucking suspicious if they're just lumping all these technologies together. Tor is build in a way that allows glows to own every single node, including the hidden service and still not know shit about you or what you're doing. 
Also, why are they mentioned in a document that discusses development of their own crypto? They don't have shit without breaking the encryption which is realistically impossible.

>>d5584c87-d427-40de-8c11-52817ec079e3
It's so weird. I'm currently seeing more than 5000 peers on 08chan. Is the lurker ratio that insane normally?  Or did anons just download and forget while still running zeronet.

>>47bffcce-571a-499b-856c-c450aa79a720
From 8chan's stats we get around 2% actives pr. 98% lurkers. Activity is also a snowball effect so more posts should entice more posters

>>3c3a82cb-2a41-49fe-a6aa-2a8f97d5b6cb
I know of nanochan, but it's pretty much dominated by a single insufferable avatarfag

>>8aad9b99-21e0-48bd-ba66-9a7f353b3c63
4cuck looks just the same and its fucking horrible. Nanochan has lower pph than 08, overchan is dead, endchan dies randomly. 
This place would have been huge if the tech was developed and ready for scale. I predict decentralization will increase as the clutches come down on the entire net. We need the enemy to go further and push people to the promised land with true freedo - just like the Jews in ww2.

>>07951974-d49e-4b7d-9780-05ec27c3d91a
Other user see "this hidden service hosts these files". You're as secure as a Tor hidden service hosting a website. Being able to correlate content to an address doesn't mean you're deanonymized.

>>e4eca2b0-f60b-4545-a9c0-f6a5fe6c4987
It will lay dormant until it's needed. When the real censorship begins.

>>57a571c8-892f-4cab-b1c4-7a8887ad5efd
If they get a warrant on you, you already fucked up more than enough. 
Also why the fuck should they? The amount of CP on this site is minuscule compared to all the pedo sites on Tor and I2P. They're interested in the creators, distributors and users that try to find children IRL. 
They give a shit about us in the capacity that many young men hungry for a war is among us. That's what they're keeping an eye on.
You need to end this namefaggotry, admin. ID's would be nice, but a default "anonymous" is ok as a beginning.

>>c055abbc-7770-4766-84b1-a0460fe60b94
how long ago was this? You can't recover shit from modern ram without liquid nitrogen.

>>bc78f528-473c-4c90-9a29-22806e873cdc
I think many /pol/acks are just laying dormant. New tech like zeronet is often scary with rumors of glows, child porn(glows) and other things. As long as you ban/mute users and use the blacklist you've legally shown direct action to remove the content. 
The law just hasn't caught up with decentralization since it's so new. You would think that a normal person can't be responsible for curating several thousand images. In a way we're all running a public forum and that does come with legal protection.

>>0053a561-8a02-46de-8084-820a04526ae1
Sorry anon, but DRAM retention is normally in the order of milliseconds to seconds at room temp. Look at this paper for clarification.

>>b6b360a9-f67b-4ee2-844e-331a46cdbeb0
There is actually a push for decentralized services from microsoft and others. Right now it's just CDN, but companies are just beginning to grasp how many shekels they could save by using the goyim as servers.
We're gonna need those laws when kikebook, jewtube and others start going decentralized to save servers and money.

>>5db5c762-f51a-4870-a2a9-d528a6a729ad
I would imagine that all power rails in a modern machine stay on during a reboot, since it's more like a global reset of all circuitry. I'm more EE than compsci so I don't really know the specifics. 
From my understanding the data retention time is based on how well the circuits in the DRAM silicon holds charge. At very low temperatures there is a lot less electrical loss(some quantum effect), which means the discharge time is increased a lot. Just the name "cold boot attack" is pretty self explanatory. 
Not too long ago TAILS os did memory overwrite at shutdown, but they realized how low the chance of a successful attack was so they did away with it.

>>e7616368-b21d-433e-9c23-583152d92c10
I just read through their docs. Seems they changed the memory wipe program to a more efficient one that erases "most" memory in their own wording. A misconception on my part.

>>480c93ad-0d7c-43b2-b80e-7095f7da150f
It's just a bunch of low IQ retards and bots replying, ignore them. I suppose this was cuckchan?
The smart ones don't reply, they just figure out why zeronet and services like it are the future of communication. Places with no kike arbiter acting as middle man.
Fearmongering is a very good filter for cattle since they just conform instead of educating themselves.

>>15070f70-04c7-4973-89df-e07dfc6ed9cc
Maybe it should just be an image with a link to the clearnet guide site and a text like "come home 8chan" with a group image of all the board mascots. 
This makes it exciting for curious anons lost in the ether of bunkers and other forum sites.

Most forum zites seem to have infinite bloat potential. I propose we allow board owners to set the maximum amount of posts for a board. 
When you create a new board, an archive version of the board will be created alongside it. This would allow anons with large amounts of space to host the archive, while others only host the main board and the posts currently up on it.

>>e7c0e1f0-d2db-4066-bda7-1b0851e5f938
Look at 8chans visitor numbers compared to the pph of all the popular boards. Millions of monthly hits nets you just above 200pph on the largest boards. 
Another example is wikis, where 10% of the users create, edit and publish articles. 
I hope for a slow growth as it would allow our coders to solve scaling issues as they arise, like the fact that all posts are eternal both in duration and length. Imagine a happening general with 5k+ posts.

>>65c206f7-0658-4ae4-a264-5c78c1fe8466
Your brain gives up before your harddrive if you have to follow a 5k post long thread.
And searching for potential issues that never happen with 1000 users but become unbearable with 10.000, is important after a single spammer fucked all the active boards into the dirt. I would rather fix them while we're small to avoid a single event rendering the site unusable.
>>b97f547d-be94-4f6a-8fc7-d9a2372b67ba
I always wonder where the other anons are, none of the bunkers seem active enough to accommodate for a userbase like 8chan's.
